metadata.title: CVE-2016-2161 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 to 2.4.23, malicious input tomod_auth_digest can cause the server to crash, and each instance continuesto crash even for subsequently valid requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2').
